public class StormRuler
extends Sword
implements IWindSlash, Resettable
Special weapon used for defeating Yhorm.

  • Method Details

    • charge

      public boolean charge​(Actor actor)
      1. Increment charges 2. Checks if weapon is fully charges 3. if fully charges, remove charge capability and add wind slash capability
      Specified by:
      charge in interface IWindSlash
      Parameters:
      actor - actor that is charging this weapon
      Returns:
      true if storm ruler is fully charged

      the maximum number of charges

    • prepareWindSlash

      public void prepareWindSlash​(Actor attacker)
      Check if attacker has wind slash capability. If true, remove the charge action + capability and buff storm ruler damage
      Specified by:
      prepareWindSlash in interface IWindSlash
      Parameters:
      attacker - actor who is about to perform wind slash

    • finishWindSlash

      public void finishWindSlash​(Actor attacker)
      1. Set damage back to default 2. Set charges to zero 3. remove wind slash capability from attacker 4. add the charge action back to allowable actions
      Specified by:
      finishWindSlash in interface IWindSlash
      Parameters:
      attacker - actor who is wind slashing

    • getPickUpAction

      public PickUpStormRulerAction getPickUpAction​(Actor actor)
      Instead return our pick-up storm ruler class instead of swap weapon action
      Overrides:
      getPickUpAction in class MeleeWeapon
      Parameters:
      actor - an actor that will interact with this item
      Returns:
      PickUpStormRuler action

    • resetInstance

      public void resetInstance​(GameMap map)
      On reset: 1. set the charges to zero 2. Set specs back to default 4. Add charge actions back if it doesn't exist
      Specified by:
      resetInstance in interface Resettable
      Parameters:
      map - instance of the game map

    • isExist

      public boolean isExist()
      Storm ruler is permanent
      Specified by:
      isExist in interface Resettable
      Returns:
      always true
